page.title: 06J.C.G. & MONT-A-L'ABBE SCH.
page.content: {The Jersey College For Girls }is built on a hill in St.Helier. It is over 105 years old. The school takes girls from 4 to 18 and boys from 4 to 7. The school is easily noticed by the two red crosses from when the school was a{German military hospital }during the{Occupation} in the {Second World {War.}It is one of Jersey's most important fee paying schools. {Mont-A-L'Abbe Special School}caters for the whole range of {mental {handicaps}in children from the ages of 3 to 18. There are 68 children at present with 12 full-time staff and 6 ancillaries. Most children move from here to sheltered employment, in particular at the {Le Geyt Centre.
